intro: Rhus nortonii, commonly known as the smooth sumac, is a deciduous shrub or small tree native to the eastern United States. It belongs to the Anacardiaceae family, which includes other plants like poison ivy and mango. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves, which are typically arranged in pairs along the stems. Its small, clustered yellowish-green flowers appear in spring, followed by red, fuzzy fruit clusters in the fall. Rhus nortonii is adapted to a variety of soil types and is often found in open woodlands and disturbed areas.
